metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2853 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description: The aufs module for the Linux kernel 3.x and 4.x does not properly restrict the mount namespace, which allows local users to gain privileges by mounting an aufs filesystem on top of a FUSE filesystem, and then executing a crafted setuid program. It was discovered that the aufs file system in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict mount namespaces, when mounted with the non-default allow_userns option set. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires aufs module inserted with allow_userns option, which is not the default fixed in upstream aufs on 2016-02-19, marking kernel's that imported aufs branches after that as not-affected

criterions.comment: linux-gke-5.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-gkeop-5.15 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm-5.15 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
